properties.name: Run, Dino run
properties.description:
The revamped version of Chrome's offline Dino runner.

Controls :
   Computer : Up and Down arrow keys
   Touch screens : Swipe up or down

events.comment: This action will display the leaderboard on top of the game scene. The display will not disable inputs or controls ; if the player clicks on the button "restart" while the leaderboard it displayed, it will restart the game. Consequently, it is recommended that the scene is switched to a blank one while the leaderboard is displayed to avoid this issue.

objects.name: ScoreText
objects.string: Press any key to start running.

content.text: Press any key to start running.

events.comment: Create the illusion that Dino is moving by moving the background and platform images
Makes ParticleEmitter follow the Dino if he lands on an Island.
Handle touchscreen.
Increase difficulty with score by reducing the spawn delay (min. 0.7 second) and increasing obstacle speed (max. 2000)

Randomly chose the obstacle type (0: single cactus, 1: island, 2: Cactus field) when spawn delay is reached. Once the obstacle is created, we reset the spawn timer.
We want to avoid scaling the force applied to one obstacle when it is already on screen, so we apply a permanent force.
Create an island with a reward (0: reward on bottom, 1: reward on top, 3: no reward).
Spawn a cactus field of length scaling with score (max 4).

Player loses when either of these conditions is checked :
- Dino collided with a Cactus
- Dino collided with an Island and is under it (= the played did not duck)

eventsBasedObjects.description: Displays the player score and allows to submit it to a leaderboard.
eventsBasedObjects.name: LeaderboardDialog

events.comment:
Handle leaderboards.
To create a leaderboard, make sure your game is registered in Home > Profile > Games Dashboard and then, click on "Manage game" > Leaderboards. When a leaderboard is created, it should be available in the actions.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the restart button of the dialog is clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsRestartClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the score has been sucessfully submitted by the dialog.
eventsFunctions.name: IsScoreSubmitted

events.comment: Allow to try and submit again in case of error.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com), Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ScreenWrap
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Teleport object when it moves off the screen and immediately appear on the opposite side while maintaining speed and trajectory.
description: The teleport happens when the center point of the object crosses a border (this can be adjusted with an offset).
By default, the borders of the wrapping area match the screen size, but they can alo be changed.
The Asteroid-like example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-asteroid)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Teleport the object when leaving one side of the screen so that it immediately reappears on the opposite side, maintaining speed and trajectory.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ScreenWrap

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the label according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterLabel

eventsFunctions.name: IsActivated

propertyDescriptors.label: Label offset on Y axis when pressed
propertyDescriptors.name: PressedLabelOffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SineMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.
description: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.
Example uses:
- Floating objects, such as powerups or coins
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
Properties:
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.

Example uses:
- Floating pickups
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Horizontal distance

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SineMovement

events.comment: Set the center of movement to the initial location of the object
Move the object
Increment counters that are used to calculate movement

eventsFunctions.description: Counter used to change the X position of the object.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak, @Bouh, Tristan Rhodes
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IsOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This adds a condition to detect if an object is on screen based off its current layer.
description: This extension adds conditions to check if an object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that this does not take into account any object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, but can be combined with those existing conditions.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This behavior provides a condition to check if the object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, is not considered (but you can use those existing conditions in addition to this behavior).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: InOnScreen

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if an object position is within the viewport of its layer.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOnScreen

inlineCode: Get the object layer, convert the position from this layer to the screen coordinates.
Get the point on each side on the object on screen, and compare with the screen area.
This way even if the camera has a rotation or custom scale the object is always compared to the screen area.
// Get the layer of the object.
// Get the aabb of the object on his layer.
// Get the layer to convert the coordinates of the AABB to the screen coordinates
// Get the points on each side of the object on screen.
const posLeftObjectOnScreen = Math.min(topLeft[0], topRight[0], bottomLeft[0], bottomRight[0]);
const posRightObjectOnScreen = Math.max(topLeft[0], topRight[0], bottomLeft[0], bottomRight[0]);
const posUpObjectOnScreen = Math.min(topLeft[1], topRight[1], bottomLeft[1], bottomRight[1]);
const posDownObjectOnScreen = Math.max(topLeft[1], topRight[1], bottomLeft[1], bottomRight[1]);

parameters.longDescription: Number of pixels to pad the screen border. Zero by default. A negative value goes inside the screen, a positive value go outside.
parameters.name: Padding
